purpose.description: Your code implements the key tasks: loads datasets, extracts Vein and Artery lifespans, computes means, performs one-sample and two-sample t-tests, and analyzes the iron data with a contingency table and chi-square test. It aligns with the project goals and runs without syntax errors.
Explicitly prints the initial Lifespans data to verify structure and ensures Task 1 is visibly completed.

readability.description: Code uses clear section headers and straightforward variable names, making it easy to follow the flow of tasks.
Some lines are slightly terse; adding minimal comments above key steps (e.g., why we test against 73) could improve readability.

performance.description: The code uses vectorized pandas filtering and NumPy means efficiently for lifespans data.

Consider caching repeated lookups (e.g., vein_pack_lifespans) is already done; ensure the contingency table creation is only computed once. Also ensure the imported test functions are used consistently for each task to avoid overwriting p-values.
